Severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) caused by SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV) erupted in November 2002 in Guangdong province, China. The epidemic occurred in China, Hong-Kong, Taiwan, Singapore, and Vietnam. A total of 8098 people were infected, with 774 deaths globally. It was transmitted by respiratory droplets and presented with fever (99%–100%), dry cough (57%–75%), and myalgia (45%–61%).
11, 12 The mean incubation period was 4–6 days. Overall, case fatality ratio was approximately 15%.
